definition:
The attribute which denotes that 
the data stream is conceived as a stream of one datum after another, and 
each datum or identifiable group of data is separated by a constant of 
time.
opposite_reasoning: StochasticDataStream is the strongest opposite for DeterministicDataStream. This pairing represents a fundamental binary opposition in information theory and data streaming: deterministic (predictable, constant-time intervals) vs stochastic (probabilistic, variable-time intervals). This opposition is widely recognized in computer science and signal processing domains. The concept likely exists in SUMO's ontology as it's a standard technical term. For AI safety monitoring, this axis could help distinguish between predictable/regular behavioral patterns vs unpredictable/irregular ones, which may be relevant for anomaly detection in AI systems.
